item.title: Alibaba’s logistics arm Cainiao offers shoppers in US grouped delivery service, cutting shipping times to five days
item.description:
English summary：

Cainiao, a logistics unit of Alibaba Group, has announced a new cross-border shipping service for Chinese customers in the US. This service will enable customers to bundle their purchases from Chinese e-commerce websites and have them shipped together, reducing delivery times and costs. The service is expected to boost the company's cross-border logistics business and contribute to its planned US$1 billion listing in Hong Kong.
  • Abstract: Cainiao launches a consolidated shipping service for Chinese consumers in the US.
  • Theme: Optimizing delivery times and costs for cross-border e-commerce purchases.
  • Viewpoint: This initiative addresses the growing demand for efficient international shipping services and supports Cainiao's expansion into overseas markets.
  • Main information: Service covers air and sea transport routes, consolidates online shopping orders from various platforms, and aims to reduce delivery times and costs. Cainiao's recent cross-border parcel deliveries exceeded 1.5 billion, making it a leading logistics provider globally.

中文总结：

阿里巴巴集团的物流子公司菜鸟，宣布针对美国境内的中国消费者推出跨境运输新服务。这项服务将允许消费者将从中国电子商务网站购买的商品捆绑在一起包装，并一起运输，从而减少交货时间和成本。预计这项服务将提振公司的跨境物流业务，并为其计划在香港进行的 10 亿美元上市做出贡献。
  • 摘要：菜鸟为美国中国消费者推出拼箱运输服务。
  • 主题：优化跨境电子商务购物的配送时间和成本。
  • 观点：这项举措满足了对高效国际运输服务日益增长的需求，并支持菜鸟向海外市场扩张。
  • 主要信息：该服务涵盖空运和海运路线，将来自不同平台的在线购物订单集中起来，并旨在减少交货时间和成本。菜鸟最近的跨境包裹配送量超过 15 亿件，使其成为全球领先的物流供应商。

单词：

  • warehouse (n.) - /ˈweərˌhaʊs/ 仓库，货栈。

    原文例句：The so-called “consolidated shipping” service, covering both air and sea transport routes, will collect multiple online shopping orders placed by users on various platforms in a warehouse before shipping them from China.

    例句讲解：这个单词由ware（货物）和house（房子）组成，表示“仓库，货栈”。在这个例句中，它指的是一个收集用户在不同平台上下的多笔在线购物订单，然后从中国发货的仓库。

  • logistics (n.) - /lɔːˈdʒɪstɪks/ 物流学，运输管理学。

    原文例句：Cainiao, Alibaba Group Holding’s logistics unit, will open a new service for consumers in the US to allow them to package several items they have bought together, cutting delivery times to as little as five days.

    例句讲解：这个单词由logo（逻辑）和istics（学问）组成，表示“物流学，运输管理学”。在这个例句中，它指的是菜鸟，阿里巴巴集团的物流子公司，将为美国消费者开通一项新服务，允许他们将购买的多件商品打包在一起，将送货时间缩短至五天。

  • delivery (n.) - /dɪˈlɪvəri/ 分娩，交付，递送。

    原文例句：If the parcel is sent via air, delivery times may be reduced five days after the items are sent out from the warehouse.

    例句讲解：这个单词由de-（离开）和livery（交付）组成，表示“分娩，交付，递送”。在这个例句中，它指的是包裹的送达，如果包裹是通过航空运输，在包裹从仓库发出后五天内就可以送达。

词组：

  • subject to - 受到……的影响，以……为准。

    原文例句：Cainiao aims to raise at least US$1 billion, subject to market conditions, according to a Post report in September that cited people familiar with the situation.

    例句讲解：这个词组由subject（主体）和to（向）组成，表示“受到……的影响，以……为准”。在这个例句中，它表示菜鸟的目标是筹集至少 10 亿美元，但具体取决于市场状况。

  • make up - 组成，构成。

    原文例句：Alibaba announced it would spin off Cainiao in the restructuring announced in March.

    例句讲解：这个词组由make（制造）和up（向上）组成，表示“组成，构成”。在这个例句中，它表示阿里巴巴宣布将在 3 月份宣布的重组中剥离菜鸟。

句子：

  • Prior to its US expansion, Cainiao provided consolidated shipping to shoppers in other markets outside mainland China, including Hong Kong, Singapore and Australia. - 在其美国扩张之前，菜鸟已向中国大陆以外其他市场（包括香港、新加坡和澳大利亚）的消费者提供合单运输服务。

    句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是Cainiao provided consolidated shipping to shoppers，其中主语是Cainiao，谓语是provided consolidated shipping，宾语是to shoppers。Prior to its US expansion是一个过去分词短语作状语，表示在菜鸟美国扩张之前。in other markets outside mainland China是一个介词短语作地点状语，表示在中国大陆以外的其他市场，包括香港、新加坡和澳大利亚。这个句子的意思是说，在菜鸟美国扩张之前，菜鸟已向中国大陆以外的其他市场（包括香港、新加坡和澳大利亚）的消费者提供合单运输服务。

语法：

  • 强调句型 - 用于强调句子中的某一部分。

    原文例句：The so-called “consolidated shipping” service covers both air and sea transport routes.

    语法讲解：这是一个强调句型，强调了句中的so-called “consolidated shipping” service。结构是：It is/was + 被强调部分 + that/who + 其他部分。在这个例句中，be动词是is，被强调部分是so-called “consolidated shipping” service，that从句是covers both air and sea transport routes。这个句子的意思是说，所谓的“拼箱运输”服务覆盖了空运和海运两种运输方式。

  • 祈使句 - 用于表示命令、请求或建议。

    原文例句：Please don't get us fired. I need this urgently for an important project.

    语法讲解：这是一个祈使句，表示说话人对听话人的命令、请求或建议。结构是：Please/Kindly/Would you please + 动词原形 + 其他。在这个例句中，说话人是第一人称，动词原形是get，其他部分是us fired。这个句子的意思是说，请不要让我们被解雇，我急需这个重要的项目。

  • Cainiao said cross-border shipping service would mainly help Chinese consumers in US who tend to buy lots of goods on Chinese sites
  • The so-called ‘consolidated shipping’ service covers both air and sea transport routes

Cainiao, Alibaba Group Holding’s logistics unit, will open a new service for consumers in the US to allow them to package several items they have bought together, cutting delivery times to as little as five days.

Cainiao said in a statement on Tuesday that the cross-border shipping service would mainly help Chinese consumers and students in the US who tend to buy lots of goods on Chinese e-commerce sites. As of 2020, there were roughly 60 million Chinese living outside the country, according to a report by Huaqiao University.

If the parcel is sent via air, delivery times may be reduced five days after the items are sent out from the warehouse. If by sea, the new service may cut the cost to as low as 12 yuan (US$1.7), depending on the size of the parcel, according to the statement.

The new overseas service comes ahead of Cainiao’s planned US$1 billion listing in Hong Kong. Alibaba owns the South China Morning Post.

Alibaba’s AliExpress, PDD-owned Temu face supply chain challenges in South Korea

The so-called “consolidated shipping” service, covering both air and sea transport routes, will collect multiple online shopping orders placed by users on various platforms in a warehouse before shipping them from China.

Prior to its US expansion, Cainiao provided consolidated shipping to shoppers in other markets outside mainland China, including Hong Kong, Singapore and Australia.

In November, Cainiao and Alibaba were part of a consortium that made a US$57 million offer to buy Chinese logistics company Best. Best is a major courier in China and has a presence in Southeast Asia. In the third quarter of 2023, Best’s global businesses achieved revenue of US$37.7 million, contributing to 12.4 per cent of the total.

Cainiao has its eye on the overseas market, and recorded more than 1.5 billion cross-border e-commerce parcel deliveries in its recent financial year to March, making it one of the world’s top logistics services providers, according to its prospectus.

Cainiao aims to raise at least US$1 billion, subject to market conditions, according to a Post report in September that cited people familiar with the situation. The listing is part of a group-wide restructuring of Alibaba, as the e-commerce titan seeks to free up decision- making amid increased competition.

Established in 2013, Cainiao serves as the logistics backbone of Alibaba’s e-commerce empire, handling more than 4 million cross-border parcels on a daily basis in 2023. Alibaba announced it would spin off Cainiao in the restructuring announced in March.

item.title: CES 2024: China TV makers Hisense and TCL promote AI, live sports at US show
item.description:
Summary：

In a competitive display at CES 2024 in Las Vegas, Chinese television giants Hisense and TCL unveiled their latest line-ups, emphasizing artificial intelligence (AI) capabilities and pushing into new areas like augmented reality (AR) and virtual reality (VR). Both companies touted their in-house production capabilities and supply chain prowess, while showcasing advancements in mini-LED technology and laser TVs. Sports and AI-enhanced picture quality were key themes, as both brands aimed to establish themselves as leading forces in the global television market.
  • Abstract: Chinese TV brands Hisense and TCL showcase AI-powered TVs and explore new technologies at CES 2024.
  • Theme: Competition and innovation among Chinese TV brands in the areas of AI, mini-LEDs, and emerging technologies.
  • Viewpoint: The importance of in-house production and supply chain control in maintaining a competitive edge.
  • Main information: Unveiling of new TV models with advanced AI features; emphasis on mini-LED technology and laser TVs; exploration of AR glasses, smart glasses, and VR headsets; partnerships with carmakers to integrate technology into vehicles.

总结：

中国电视巨头海信和TCL在拉斯维加斯举行的2024年国际消费类电子产品展览会（CES）上激烈竞争，展示了各自最新的产品阵容，强调人工智能（AI）功能，并进军增强现实（AR）和虚拟现实（VR）等新领域。两家公司都宣称其拥有自主生产能力和供应链优势，同时展示了在Mini LED技术和激光电视方面的进步。体育和基于AI的画质提升是本次展会的主题，两大品牌都旨在树立其在全球电视市场中的领导地位。
  • 摘要：中国电视品牌海信和TCL在2024年国际消费类电子产品展览会上展示了搭载人工智能技术的电视，并探索了新技术。
  • 主题：中国电视品牌在人工智能、Mini LED和新兴技术领域的竞争与创新。
  • 观点：自主生产和供应链控制在保持竞争优势中的重要性。
  • 主要信息：推出搭载先进人工智能功能的新款电视；强调Mini LED技术和激光电视；探索AR眼镜、智能眼镜和VR头盔；与汽车制造商合作，将技术集成到汽车中。

单词：

  • unveil (v.) - /ʌnˈveɪl/ 揭幕，公布。

    原文例句：Chinese television set makers Hisense and TCL unveiled their latest line-ups at CES 2024 in Las Vegas on Monday, with an emphasis on artificial intelligence (AI) and making screens the centre of the home, while pushing into new areas like cars.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于古法语dévoiler，表示“揭示，公布”。在这个例句中，它指的是中国电视制造商海信和TCL在拉斯维加斯举行的2024年国际消费类电子产品展览会上公布了他们的最新产品阵容。

  • emphasis (n.) - /ˈɛmfəsɪs/ 强调，重点。

    原文例句：Both companies offered competing narratives, presenting themselves as the biggest Chinese brands in the US television space. They also boasted about their supply chain prowess and the ability to manufacture leading technologies in-house.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于古希腊语émphasis，表示“重视，强调”。在这个例句中，它指的是两家公司对供应链能力和自主制造领先技术的自夸。

词组：

  • in-house - 内部，本地的。

    原文例句：Hisense president David Gold on stage at CES 2024 in Las Vegas on Monday. Photo: Matt Haldane

    例句讲解：这个词组表示“内部的，本地的”。在这个例句中，它指的是Hisense总裁David Gold在拉斯维加斯举行的2024年国际消费类电子产品展览会上的照片。

句子：

  • The companies emphasised their ability to produce much of their technology in-house and how they are branching out into areas like AR. - 这两家公司强调了它们能够在内部生产大量技术的能力，以及它们如何进军增强现实等领域。

    句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是The companies emphasised their ability to produce，其中主语是The companies，谓语是emphasised，宾语是their ability to produce。much of their technology in-house是一个定语从句，修饰主语The companies，表示这些公司能够在内部生产大量技术。how they are branching out into areas like AR是一个宾语从句，修饰主语The companies，表示这些公司如何进军增强现实等领域。这个句子的意思是说，这两家公司强调了它们能够在内部生产大量技术的能力，以及它们如何进军增强现实等领域。

语法：

  • 现在完成时 - 表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态。

    原文例句：TCL referred to itself as a “great global power” with 32 research and development centres and 43 manufacturing sites around the world.

    语法讲解：现在完成时是由have/has和过去分词构成的，表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态。在这个例句中，TCL referred to itself as a “great global power”是一个现在完成时的句子，表示TCL一直以来都将自己称为一个“伟大的全球力量”。

  • The two biggest Chinese TV brands offered competing narratives about their global stature and AI processing capabilities
  • The companies emphasised their ability to produce much of their technology in-house and how they are branching out into areas like AR

Chinese television set makers Hisense and TCL unveiled their latest line-ups at CES 2024 in Las Vegas on Monday, with an emphasis on artificial intelligence (AI) and making screens the centre of the home, while pushing into new areas like cars.

Both companies offered competing narratives, presenting themselves as the biggest Chinese brands in the US television space. They also boasted about their supply chain prowess and the ability to manufacture leading technologies in-house.

David Gold, president of Hisense USA, said the company’s ability to produce displays and even its own AI chipsets without third parties is something that sets it apart.

“When you think about global players, I think we are one of less than a handful of companies that have everything that it takes to be able to truly provide a smart home solution,” Gold said after the Hisense presentation. “We have all the ingredients, all the components. There are very few companies out there that can do the same.”

Tech giants Alibaba, ByteDance lead China’s return to CES

The flagship product from Hisense this year is its new 110-inch ULED X television with a brightness of 10,000 nits and 40,000 backlight zones.

Not to be outdone, TCL announced what it said is the world’s largest mini-LED TV at 115 inches. TCL referred to itself as a “great global power” with 32 research and development centres and 43 manufacturing sites around the world.

Mini LEDs featured prominently in the presentations of both Hisense and TCL, as they each presented their brands as the best option for finding this tech in TVs that cost just a few hundred dollars, rather than thousands.

Hisense said that mini LEDs – which cram more LEDs into a display to offer a greater range of contrast and image quality – are now integrated into all its models, including one for under US$500.

Hisense also introduced its new so-called laser TVs, which are projectors combined with an ambient-light-rejecting screen. The company said its newest 8K Sonic Laser TV is the “world’s largest sound-emitting screen”, offering a sound bar-like experience built into the projector. It is also offering a new Rollable Laser TV, which is exactly what it sounds like: a projector screen that rolls up and disappears, offering a cleaner look at home when not in use.

Both companies used sports to draw attention to their new TVs. As more viewers switch to streaming, the focus on live television has largely fallen to sports, a major reason households remain subscribed to cable and satellite TV packages.

TCL leaned into this heavily, inviting sportscasters including Charissa Thompson and former National Football League player Charles Woodson on stage for nearly the entire duration of the presentation.

Hisense highlighted the ability of its AI chips to enhance picture quality by identifying whether the video is coming from streaming, cable or another source.

“[Our AI is] about recognising what content it is, the quality, the factor in which it’s being displayed – whether it’s streaming, cable, DVDs, Blu-ray – and finding the way to enhance that picture quality,” Gold said. “Usually you put in one setting and never change it again. What we’re trying to do with AI is automatically detect, ‘Oh, now you’re watching football, let’s move to a sport setting’.”

Seemingly omnipresent at CES 2024, AI was mentioned repeatedly during both presentations, as it has been by rivals like Samsung and LG.

TCL talked of enhancing access to its AI processing with three levels of its AIPQ processors, which include “pro” and “ultra” versions. The AI processors are now offered in its cheaper S Class series.

While TVs are typically the highlight for these events from the Chinese display giants, they are also chasing other trends in the industry. TCL mentioned the latest version of the RayNeo X2 smart glasses, which can display images on the lenses to do things like offer real-time text translation. TCL incubated RayNeo.

The company also highlighted its newest smartphones and tablets with an emphasis on its Nxtpaper display, which is meant to be easier on the eyes like e-reader displays.

Hisense is working on its own augmented reality (AR) glasses and a virtual reality headset, but both are just prototypes for now.

It has also followed many of its Chinese peers – like Xiaomi and Huawei Technologies – into the auto sector. It is working on bringing its projector technology into cars to, among other things, turn the windscreen into an AR display. The company said this enhances safety because drivers do not need to take their eyes off the road when getting information like navigation.

“If you’re on the road and your smart refrigerator can tell you, ‘hey, you’re out of eggs; so on your way home, stop by and pick up some eggs,’ that’s the idea that we’re going for,” Gold said.

Many tech firms are betting on cars as the next big area of growth. As leaders in electric vehicles, Chinese companies are benefiting from the trend. Carmakers Li Auto, Great Wall Motor, Zeekr and Xiaomi will all use Nvidia’s Drive tech for autonomous driving, the chip firm announced on Monday.

Samsung and Sony also discussed their own partnerships with carmakers in their presentations on Monday. Sony has partnered with Honda on its Afeela joint venture, while Samsung is partnering with Hyundai to bring its SmartThings platform to cars.

item.title: JD.com’s on-demand delivery unit, Dada Nexus, loses 46 per cent of US stock value overnight amid internal inquiry into potential fraud
item.description:
English Summary：

- Dada Nexus, a Chinese on-demand delivery firm affiliated with JD.com, lost 46% of its stock value after an internal audit revealed 1 billion yuan (US$140 million) in questionable revenue and costs. - The audit, conducted during the first three quarters of 2023, raised concerns about the company's financial integrity and led to the resignation of several top executives, including the chairman and chief financial officer. - The incident has further eroded investor confidence in Chinese tech stocks and highlights the need for stronger corporate governance and internal controls in the sector.
  • Abstract: Internal audit reveals questionable financial data at Dada Nexus, causing stock plunge and executive departures.
  • Theme: Financial irregularities at a Chinese tech company raise concerns about corporate governance and investor confidence.
  • Viewpoint: The need for transparency and accountability in the Chinese tech sector to rebuild investor trust.
  • Main information: Identification of questionable revenue and costs during internal audit; resignations of top executives; impact on investor confidence in Chinese tech stocks.

中文总结：

- 与京东关联的中国即时配送公司达达快送在内部审计中发现10亿元人民币（1.4亿美元）可疑收入和成本，股价暴跌46%。 - 在2023年前三个季度的审计中，公司财务出现问题，导致多位高管辞职，包括董事长和首席财务官。 - 该事件进一步侵蚀了投资者对中国科技股的信心，凸显了该行业加强公司治理和内部控制的必要性。
  • 摘要：内部审计发现达达快送财务数据可疑，导致股价暴跌和高管离职。
  • 主题：中国科技公司财务违规，引发对公司治理和投资者信心的担忧。
  • 观点：中国科技行业需要透明度和问责制，以重建投资者信任。
  • 主要信息：内部审计中发现可疑收入和成本；高管辞职；对中国科技股投资者信心的影响。

单词：

  • audit (n.) - /ˈɑːdɪt/ 审计

    原文例句：A routine internal audit at Dada found US$140 million worth of questionable revenue and costs in the firm’s books for the first three quarters of 2023.

    例句讲解：这个名词源于拉丁语audire（倾听），表示“对财务记录或账户进行检查和核实”。在这个例句中，它指的是达达公司在2023年前三个季度对其财务账目进行的例行内部审计。

  • fraud (n.) - /frɔːd/ 欺诈

    原文例句：A potential case of fraud at JD.com-affiliated, on-demand delivery firm Dada Nexus could further undermine investor confidence in Chinese tech stocks.

    例句讲解：这个名词来源于古法语fraude，表示“欺骗或不诚实的行为”。在这个例句中，它指的是京东旗下的即时配送公司达达快送可能存在欺诈行为，这可能会进一步损害投资者对中国科技股的信心。

词组：

  • internal audit - 内部审计

    原文例句：A routine internal audit at Dada found US$140 million worth of questionable revenue and costs in the firm’s books for the first three quarters of 2023.

    例句讲解：这个词组由internal（内部的）和audit（审计）组成，表示“对组织或公司的财务记录和账户进行审查”。在这个例句中，它指的是达达公司对2023年前三个季度的财务账目进行的例行内部审计。

句子：

  • Dada Nexus, which operates JD Daojia and Dada Now, found 1 billion yuan (US$140 million) worth of questionable revenue and costs in its books for the first three quarters of 2023 during a routine internal audit, according to its corporate filing. - 达达快送在2023年前三个季度的例行内部审计中发现，其财务账目中有10亿元人民币（1.4亿美元）的可疑收入和成本，根据其公司文件显示。

    句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是Dada Nexus found 1 billion yuan (US$140 million) worth of questionable revenue and costs in its books，其中主语是Dada Nexus，谓语是found，宾语是1 billion yuan (US$140 million) worth of questionable revenue and costs。which operates JD Daojia and Dada Now是一个非限制性定语从句，修饰Dada Nexus，表示达达快送运营京东到家和达达快送。during a routine internal audit是一个介词短语作状语，表示审计的时间，即在例行内部审计中。according to its corporate filing是一个介词短语作状语，表示消息来源，即根据其公司文件显示。这个句子的意思是说，达达快送在2023年前三个季度的例行内部审计中发现，其财务账目中有10亿元人民币（1.4亿美元）的可疑收入和成本，根据其公司文件显示。

语法：

  • 过去分词短语作定语 - 用于修饰名词或代词，提供更多信息。

    原文例句：The audit, conducted during the first three quarters of 2023, raised concerns about the company's financial integrity and led to the resignation of several top executives, including the chairman and chief financial officer.

    语法讲解：在这个句子中，conducted during the first three quarters of 2023是一个过去分词短语，作定语，修饰audit，表示审计是在2023年前三个季度进行的。这个短语提供了更多关于审计的信息，包括审计的时间范围。

  • 动名词短语作主语 - 用于构成主句的主语，表示动作或状态。

    原文例句：The investigation at Dada comes nearly a month since the company’s chairman, Xin Lijun, stepped down from his post “for personal reasons” effective on December 19.

    语法讲解：在这个句子中，The investigation at Dada是一个动名词短语，作主语，表示对达达的调查。这个短语表示了一个动作或状态，即对达达的调查。需要注意的是，动名词短语作主语时，动词通常采用现在分词形式。

  • A routine internal audit at Dada found US$140 million worth of questionable revenue and costs in the firm’s books for the first three quarters of 2023
  • Shanghai-based Dada has reported the potential case of fraud to police, according to local media

An on-demand delivery firm affiliated with Chinese e-commerce giant JD.com lost 46 per cent of its stock value in New York on Monday, following an inquiry into “suspicious” data during an internal audit, dealing a fresh blow to confidence in China’s tech stocks.

Dada Nexus, which operates JD Daojia and Dada Now, found 1 billion yuan (US$140 million) worth of questionable revenue and costs in its books for the first three quarters of 2023 during a routine internal audit, according to its corporate filing. Parent JD.com’s share price tumbled 3 per cent on Tuesday in Hong Kong.

Nasdaq-listed Dada said an estimated 500 million yuan of online advertising and marketing service revenue plus another 500 million yuan of operations and support costs for the first three quarters of 2023 may have been overstated.

While the amount that is subject of the inquiry makes up just about a third of Dada’s total revenue in the September quarter, a potential fraud in the company’s books could further undermine investor confidence in Chinese internet stocks.

The investigation at Dada comes nearly a month since the company’s chairman, Xin Lijun, stepped down from his post “for personal reasons” effective on December 19. In that same corporate announcement of management changes at Dada, Chen Zhaoming resigned as the firm’s chief financial officer.

Shanghai-based Dada, according to a report by Chinese news outlet The Paper, has reported the potential fraud case to local police.

A JD.com representative referred the South China Morning Post to Dada’s US filing and declined to provide further details. Dada did not immediately respond to a request for comment on Tuesday.

Dada had earlier said it was working with third-party agencies, including an accounting company and a law firm, to conduct an independent review of the case.

In separate filings with regulators, both JD.com and Dada said they are committed to maintaining high corporate-governance standards and internal controls.

Chinese e-commerce giant JD.com wins antitrust lawsuit against Alibaba

Founded in Shanghai in 2014, Dada runs two core businesses: parent JD.com’s on-demand retail platform JD Daojia and its own Dada Now. Both these operations work with bricks-and-mortar retailers and merchants on fulfilment, including delivery of online orders to consumers in under roughly an hour.

JD Daojia operates in more than 1,700 counties, districts and cities across mainland China, while Dada Now does business in 2,700 domestic locations.

In November, Dada reported that total third-quarter revenue rose 20.4 per cent year on year to 2.9 billion yuan.

On-demand delivery is a hotly contested field on the mainland, where Dada competes against the likes of food delivery giant Meituan and JD.com rival Alibaba Group Holding, which owns the Post.

item.title: ByteDance confirms talks with Tencent, other potential buyers over sale of video game operations
item.description:
Summary：

ByteDance, the owner of TikTok, is in talks with several potential buyers, including Tencent, for the sale of its video game operations. This decision comes after the company failed to achieve returns from its gaming investments despite spending heavily on game development. ByteDance has been restructuring its gaming business and focusing on long-term strategic growth areas.
  • Abstract: ByteDance is selling its video game operations after failing to generate returns from its gaming investments.
  • Theme: ByteDance's unsuccessful venture into the video game industry and its decision to restructure its gaming business.
  • Viewpoint: The challenges faced by tech companies in the video game industry; the importance of focusing on core competencies.
  • Main information: Negotiations with potential buyers; restructuring of the gaming business; ByteDance's previous investments in video games.

总结：

字节跳动，也就是 TikTok 的所有者，正在与多家潜在买家谈判，其中包括腾讯，以出售其视频游戏业务。做出这个决定是因为字节跳动在游戏开发上投入巨资，但未能从其游戏投资中获得回报。字节跳动一直在重组其游戏业务，并专注于长期的战略增长领域。
  • 摘要：字节跳动在未能从其游戏投资中获得回报后，正在出售其视频游戏业务。
  • 主题：字节跳动在视频游戏行业的失败尝试，以及其决定重组游戏业务。
  • 观点：科技公司在视频游戏行业面临的挑战；专注于核心能力的重要性。
  • 主要信息：与潜在买家的谈判；游戏业务的重组；字节跳动以前在视频游戏上的投资。

单词：

  • revenue (n.) - /ˈrev.ə.njuː/ 收入，营业额。

    原文例句：Tencent Holdings, the world’s biggest gaming company by revenue.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于法语，表示“收入，营业额，收益”。在这个例句中，它指的是腾讯公司通过其游戏业务获得的收入。

  • lay-off (n.) - /ˈleɪ ɔːf/ 暂时解雇，裁员。

    原文例句：ByteDance also started lay-offs at its games unit, which employs nearly 2,000 people.

    例句讲解：这个单词是由lay（躺下）和off（离开）构成的，表示“暂时解雇，裁员”。在这个例句中，它指的是字节跳动对其游戏部门进行裁员。

  • enthusiast (n.) - /ɪnˈθjuːziæst/ 爱好者，热情者。

    原文例句：ByteDance founder Zhang Yiming, who stepped down as chairman and CEO in 2021, was never a video gaming enthusiast before dipping his toe in the market.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于希腊语，表示“爱好者，热情者”。在这个例句中，它指的是字节跳动创始人张一鸣，他并不是一个视频游戏爱好者。

词组：

  • shut down - 关闭，停业。

    原文例句：The company told employees that it would shut down most game projects that had not been released online.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由shut（关闭）和down（向下）构成的，表示“关闭，停业”。在这个例句中，它指的是字节跳动关闭其大部分尚未发布的游戏项目。

  • strategic move - 战略举措，策略性行动。

    原文例句：Some workers who want to remain at ByteDance could be allowed to transfer to other teams, the Post reported.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由strategic（战略的）和move（行动）构成的，表示“战略举措，策略性行动”。在这个例句中，它指的是字节跳动允许一些员工转到其他团队。

  • regulatory move - 监管举措，监管行动。

    原文例句：China’s erratic regulatory moves against Big Tech must end, party paper says

    例句讲解：这个词组是由regulatory（监管的）和move（行动）构成的，表示“监管举措，监管行动”。在这个例句中，它指的是中国政府对大型科技公司的监管行动。

句子：

  • ByteDance also started lay-offs at its games unit, which employs nearly 2,000 people, although the exact number of affected employees was not clear. - 字节跳动还对其游戏部门开始了裁员，该部门雇佣了近 2,000 人，尽管受影响的员工的确切数量尚不清楚。

    句子分析：这是一个复杂句，主句是ByteDance also started lay-offs at its games unit，其中主语是ByteDance，谓语是started lay-offs，宾语是at its games unit。which employs nearly 2,000 people是一个限制性定语从句，修饰先行词ByteDance，表示字节跳动对其游戏部门开始了裁员，该部门雇佣了近 2,000 人。although the exact number of affected employees was not clear是一个让步状语从句，修饰谓语started lay-offs，表示尽管受影响的员工的确切数量尚不清楚。这个句子的意思是说，字节跳动还对其游戏部门开始了裁员，该部门雇佣了近 2,000 人，尽管受影响的员工的确切数量尚不清楚。

语法：

  • 时间状语从句 - 表示时间，说明句子中所述动作或事件发生的时间。

    原文例句：ByteDance also started lay-offs at its games unit, which employs nearly 2,000 people, although the exact number of affected employees was not clear.

    语法讲解：这是一个时间状语从句，位于主句之前，由when引导，表示“当……”或“在……的时候”。在这个句子中，它表示“当字节跳动在其游戏部门开始裁员时”。時間狀語從句裡面有從句的主詞The exact number of affected employees，謂語was not clear，可以分析成名詞子句，在從句中作主語。

  • 让步状语从句 - 表示句子中所述动作或事件尽管受到阻碍或限制，但仍然发生。

    原文例句：Tencent Holdings, the world’s biggest gaming company by revenue.

    语法讲解：这是一个让步状语从句，由although引导，表示“尽管……”或“即使……”。在这个例句中，它表示“尽管腾讯公司是世界上最大的游戏公司，但它仍然面临着挑战”。

  • Local media reported that ByteDance was lowering the valuation of its gaming studios to try and make a deal after spending more than US$14 million developing titles
  • Despite its huge success with short video app TikTok and its Chinese version Douyin, ByteDance has failed to achieve returns from its gaming investments

TikTok owner ByteDance has confirmed that it is in talks with multiple potential buyers for its video game operations, including Tencent Holdings, the world’s biggest gaming company by revenue.

The confirmation from a ByteDance representative on Tuesday came after local media outlet LatePost reported that the company's gaming unit Nuverse was in negotiations with Tencent regarding the disposal of its operations. According to the report, ByteDance was lowering the valuation of its video gaming studios to try and make a deal after spending more than 100 million yuan (US$14 million) developing various titles.

The representative said that the company has not reached an agreement with Tencent.

In November, the South China Morning Post reported that the Beijing-based company told employees that it would shut down most game projects that had not been released online, and sell rights to at least two of its titles – the anime-style role-playing game Crystal of Atlan and sci-fi survival game Earth: Revival.

China’s erratic regulatory moves against Big Tech must end, party paper says

ByteDance also started lay-offs at its games unit, which employs nearly 2,000 people, although the exact number of affected employees was not clear. Some workers who want to remain at ByteDance could be allowed to transfer to other teams, the Post reported.

A ByteDance representative said at the time that it decided to “restructure its gaming business” and “make adjustments to focus on long-term strategic growth areas”.

Despite its huge success with short video app TikTok and its Chinese version Douyin, ByteDance has failed to achieve returns from its video gaming investments. The company spent around 30 billion yuan on video game acquisitions and investments involving more than 20 studios between 2019 and 2022, according to local media outlet DingjiaoOne.

“While the company made US$54 billion in the first half of 2023, less than 1 per cent of that came from their video games business,” said Lisa Hanson, chief executive of gaming industry consultancy Niko Partners.

ByteDance founder Zhang Yiming, who stepped down as chairman and CEO in 2021, was never a video gaming enthusiast before dipping his toe in the market.

Yan Shou, head of ByteDance’s video gaming unit, spent most of his career in strategic investments and hired several people with a consulting and strategy background to help him run the unit, the Post reported.

Zhang had grown impatient with the slow development, complaining in 2022 about the lack of progress at the gaming division during a video call with executives, saying that its Moonton studio had not grown despite doubling its headcount, tech media outlet The Information reported in December. Reuters reported a month earlier that ByteDance was in talks to sell Moonton.

item.title: Nvidia rolls out new chips, claims leadership of 'AI PC' race
item.description:
English summary：

  • Nvidia unveiled new products at the CES trade show in Las Vegas, including three new desktop graphics chips with extra components for AI use.
  • The company claims its new graphics chips are the best engines to power the new types of laptops and desktops, offering an order-of-magnitude improvement over Intel-powered machines.
  • Nvidia also unveiled an RTX 4070 Ti Super and a 4070 Super, priced at US$799 and US$599 respectively.
  • The new chips are expected to attract laptop owners and corporate buyers to upgrade their equipment, as they offer more realistic gaming, improved dialogue, and more responsive image-editing tools.
  • Nvidia said its new products will not trigger the US government's rules on AI-related chips export to China, unlike the top-of-the-line GTX 4090.

中文总结：

  • Nvidia在拉斯维加斯的CES贸易展上发布了多款新产品，其中包括三款带有额外AI组件的桌面图形芯片。
  • 该公司宣称，其新型图形芯片是驱动新型笔记本和台式机电脑的最佳引擎，比英特尔驱动的机器提供了数量级提升。
  • Nvidia还公布了RTX 4070 Ti Super和4070 Super，售价分别为799美元和599美元。
  • 预计新芯片将吸引笔记本电脑用户和企业购买者升级他们的设备，因为它们提供更逼真的游戏、改进的对话和更灵敏的图像编辑工具。
  • Nvidia表示，其新产品不会触发美国政府对AI相关芯片对中国的出口限制，而顶级GTX 4090会受到此类限制。

单词：

  • touted (v.) - /taʊt/ 宣扬，大力宣传。

    原文例句：Intel and AMD have already touted AI PCs as a new era for the industry, arguing that AI software is more secure and responsive on the PC than over the internet.

    例句讲解：这个单词是由tout（吹嘘，夸耀）构成的，表示“宣扬，大力宣传”。在这个例句中，它指的是英特尔和AMD已经宣扬人工智能电脑是行业的新时代，认为人工智能软件在电脑上比在互联网上更安全、更灵敏。

  • magnitude (n.) - /ˈmægnɪˌtjuːd/ 大小，程度。

    原文例句：Paired with new software and optimisations of AI models that Nvidia is also releasing, the products will offer an “order-of-magnitude” improvement over machines that are powered by Intel chips, according to Justin Walker, an Nvidia vice-president.

    例句讲解：这个单词是由拉丁语magnitudo（大小）构成的，表示“大小，程度”。在这个例句中，它指的是Nvidia的副总裁贾斯汀·沃克认为，与Nvidia即将发布的新软件和人工智能模型优化相结合，这些产品将比英特尔芯片驱动的机器提供数量级提升。

词组：

  • fall afoul of - 违反，触犯。

    原文例句：The top-of-the-line GTX 4090 already fell afoul of those restrictions, requiring Nvidia to produce a less-capable version for that market.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由fall（跌倒）和afoul（错误，过错）构成的，表示“违反，触犯”。在这个例句中，它指的是顶级的GTX 4090已经违反了这些限制，要求Nvidia为此市场生产一个功能较弱的版本。

句子：

  • Nvidia, whose chip technology dominates in data centres used to create artificial intelligence (AI) software, announced new products to help the personal computer industry lure consumers with “AI PCs”. - Nvidia whose chip technology dominates in data centres used to create artificial intelligence (AI) software, announced new products to help the personal computer industry lure consumers with “AI PCs”.

    句子分析：这是一个长句，主句是Nvidia announced new products to help the personal computer industry lure consumers with “AI PCs”。其中Nvidia是主语，announced 是谓语，new products to help the personal computer industry lure consumers with “AI PCs”是宾语。whose chip technology dominates in data centres used to create artificial intelligence (AI) software是一个定语从句，修饰Nvidia，表示Nvidia的芯片技术在用于创建人工智能软件的数据中心中占主导地位。这个句子的意思是说，Nvidia凭借其在数据中心中用于创建人工智能软件的主导地位，宣布了新产品以帮助个人电脑行业以“人工智能电脑”吸引消费者。

语法：

  • 现在完成时 - 表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态。

    原文例句：Nvidia has avoided the worst of the PC plunge by owning the market for accelerator chips used to create AI software in data centres.

    语法讲解：这是一个时态，结构是：have/has + been + 现在分词。其中have/has要根据主语的人称和数进行变化，been是be的过去分词，现在分词是动词的-ing形式。这种时态表示动作或状态从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在，强调动作或状态的持续性和未完成性。在这个例句中，it表示Nvidia通过拥有用于在数据中心创建人工智能软件的加速器芯片市场来避免了个人电脑暴跌的最坏情况。

  • 过去进行时 - 表示过去正在进行的动作或状态。

    原文例句：Nvidia’s stock rose as much as 5 per cent in New York trading on Monday, taking it back above US$500 a share to a record high.

    语法讲解：这是一个时态，结构是：was/were + 现在分词。其中was/were要根据主语的人称和数进行变化，现在分词是动词的-ing形式。这种时态表示动作或状态在过去某个时间正在进行，强调动作或状态的延续性。在这个例句中，it表示Nvidia的股票在纽约星期一的交易中上涨了5%，使其回升至每股500美元以上，创历史新高。

  • Intel and AMD have already touted AI PCs as a new era for the industry, arguing that AI software is more secure and responsive on the PC than over the internet
  • The new GeForce RTX 4080 Super can run Stable Diffusion XL image generation software 1.7 times faster than the equivalent model from the previous generation

Nvidia, whose chip technology dominates in data centres used to create artificial intelligence (AI) software, announced new products to help the personal computer industry lure consumers with “AI PCs”.

Nvidia unveiled three new desktop graphics chips with extra components that will let gamers, designers and other computer users make better use of AI on their personal machines, without having to rely on remote services accessed over the internet. The chips, updated versions of existing offerings, will be offered at a “great new price”, the company said on Monday in a presentation at the CES trade show in Las Vegas.

The company's major rivals, Intel and Advanced Micro Devices, have already touted what they say is a new era for the industry: AI PCs. The companies argue that AI software is more secure and responsive when it is run on the PCs themselves rather than over the internet.

Nvidia now claims its graphics chips are the best engines to power the new types of laptops and desktops.

Nvidia expands its reach in China’s electric vehicle sector

The new GeForce RTX 4080 Super will get more processing cores and faster memory. It can run Stable Diffusion XL image generation software 1.7 times faster than the equivalent model from the previous generation of Nvidia technology, the company said. The new chip will also power games with ray tracing – building an image by calculating the path of individual rays of light – at 4K resolution.

The product is scheduled to go on sale from January 31 for US$999. The company also unveiled an RTX 4070 Ti Super for US$799 and a 4070 Super for US$599, which will be available later this month.

Paired with new software and optimisations of AI models that Nvidia is also releasing, the products will offer an “order-of-magnitude” improvement over machines that are powered by Intel chips, according to Justin Walker, an Nvidia vice-president.

Nvidia’s stock rose as much as 5 per cent in New York trading on Monday, taking it back above US$500 a share to a record high. The stock more than tripled last year, giving the company a market value of more than US$1 trillion.

Non-tech Chinese firms tout orders of Nvidia chips, winning stock boosts

After a spike in sales during the pandemic, PC shipments have fallen steeply, leaving makers and component suppliers burdened with inventory and little growth. Nvidia has avoided the worst of the PC plunge by owning the market for accelerator chips used to create AI software in data centres. The explosion in demand for that more expensive type of chip has pushed Nvidia’s market value past US$1 trillion, making it the most valuable company in the history of the semiconductor industry.

For chip makers in general, though, the majority of the volume they ship still goes into PCs. They are searching for a way to persuade laptop owners and corporate buyers to upgrade their equipment and have begun touting AI capabilities as a reason for new purchases.

Nvidia said the new chips will provide more realistic gaming with high-definition images enhanced by AI, which will also generate improved dialogue by in-game characters. In another example, the products will provide more responsive tools for image-editing software from companies such as Adobe. There are currently 500 applications that are tuned to work better with AI and Nvidia’s RTX technology, the company said.

Separately, Nvidia said the capabilities of its new products will not trigger rules put in place by the US government to limit the export of AI-related chips to China. The top-of-the-line GTX 4090 already fell afoul of those restrictions, requiring Nvidia to produce a less-capable version for that market.

item.title: Apple’s Vision Pro headset launches next month, as US tech giant seeks to expand mixed-reality market
item.description:

单词：

  • immersive (adj.) - /ɪˈmɜːsɪv/ 沉浸式的，身临其境的。

    原文例句：The Vision Pro already has got largely enthusiastic reviews among the media who were able to test it in tightly controlled demonstrations monitored by Apple.

    例句讲解：沉浸式（immersive）是指一种让你感觉完全沉浸在某个环境或体验中的东西。在这个例子中，“immersive”表示媒体对Vision Pro头戴式设备的评论大多是积极的，他们在苹果公司严密控制的演示中测试了这款设备，并感到非常身临其境。

词组：

  • potential audience - 潜在受众，潜在观众。

    原文例句：Industry analysts believe Apple has the potential to expand the technology’s audience beyond the video gamers and mostly tech nerds that have embraced it so far.

    例句讲解：“potential audience”

    • Apple says the goggles’ operating system will be compatible with more than 1 million apps designed for the iPhone and iPad, with pre-orders beginning January 19
    • Industry analysts believe Apple has the potential to expand the technology’s audience beyond the video gamers and mostly tech nerds that have embraced it so far

    Apple’s high-priced headset for toggling between the real and digital world will be available in its stores beginning February 2, launching the trendsetting company’s push to broaden the appeal of what so far has been a niche technology.

    Apple unveiled the sleek US$3,500 goggles at a software conference held at its Cupertino, California, headquarters eight months ago – an event that was designed to encourage developers to make apps tailored for a device that projects users into three-dimensional simulations of reality.

    Apple’s announcement coincides with the annual CES trade show in Las Vegas, where the company has long been conspicuously absent.

    Apple says the goggles’ operating system will be compatible with more than 1 million apps designed for the iPhone and iPad. Pre-orders begin January 19, but buyers will have to go to a store to be properly fitted for the goggles, which are controlled with the eyes and a few simple hand gestures.

    Qualcomm unveils chip for mixed reality to compete with Apple’s Vision Pro

    Although Facebook owner Meta Platforms and other companies have been making virtual-reality headsets for years with limited success, many industry analysts believe Apple has the potential to expand the technology’s audience beyond the video gamers and mostly tech nerds that have embraced it so far.

    The Vision Pro already has got largely enthusiastic reviews among the media who were able to test it in tightly controlled demonstrations monitored by Apple, but the device’s price tag probably means relatively few unit sales during its first year on the market.

    Even so, Apple’s first new product since its smartwatch debuted a decade ago could set the stage for the introduction of more affordable versions for a broader audience. Right now, the Vision Pro will cost seven times more than Meta’s latest virtual-reality headset, the Quest 3.

    In a sign that Apple is expecting the Vision Pro to pave the way to a bigger market, the company included the ability to take 3D videos that can be viewed through the goggles on its latest premium iPhones, the 15 Pro and 15 Pro Max. These videos are so realistic that the people and other images in them appear to be right in front of the viewer watching them.

    Apple is looking for ways to juice its sales after suffering a slight decline in revenue during its last fiscal year ended September. Apple still raked in US$383 billion in sales, with the iPhone accounting for more than half that amount.

item.title: Samsung profit tumbles 35% as chip weakness persists
item.description:
Summary：

South Korean tech giant Samsung Electronics reported a decline in its operating income for the sixth consecutive quarter, primarily due to weak global demand for consumer electronics. The company aims to boost its presence in the high-density memory chip market and plans to increase its production capacity by 2.5 times in 2024. Samsung hopes to counteract the slowdown in smartphone and memory chip demand by introducing new devices and foldable smartphones.
  • Abstract: Samsung Electronics faces challenges due to declining demand for consumer electronics, leading to a reduction in operating income.
  • Theme: Samsung's strategic focus on high-density memory chips and new devices to drive growth in challenging market conditions.
  • Viewpoint: The impact of weak consumer demand and economic uncertainty on the electronics industry; Samsung's efforts to navigate these challenges.
  • Main information: Samsung's financial results for the quarter, including revenue and operating income; the company's plans to increase production capacity for memory chips; the introduction of new devices and foldable smartphones.

总结：

韩国科技巨头三星电子连续六个季度运营利润下降，主要原因是全球对消费电子的需求疲软。公司旨在提高其在高密度存储芯片市场的地位，并计划在 2024 年将其生产能力提高 2.5 倍。三星希望通过推出新设备和可折叠智能手机来抵消智能手机和存储芯片需求的放缓。这家韩国科技巨头准备在本月晚些时候在美国推出其最新产品，当时投资者担心苹果的 iPhone 15 可能在发布后短短几个月内就会失去动力。
  • 摘要：由于对消费电子的需求下降，三星电子面临挑战，导致营业收入减少。
  • 主题：三星在具有挑战性的市场条件下战略性地专注于高密度存储芯片和新设备来推动增长。
  • 观点：疲软的消费者需求和经济不确定性对电子行业的影响；三星应对这些挑战的努力。
  • 主要信息：三星当季财务业绩，包括收入和营业收入；公司计划增加存储芯片的产能；推出新设备和可折叠智能手机。

单词：

  • Underscore (v.) —— 记号，强调，强调。

    原文例句：The results underscore how demand for smartphones and the memory chips that power modern electronics remains sluggish given economic uncertainty.

    例句讲解：这个单词由under（在……以下）和score（分数，评级）组成，表示“划线，强调，强调”。在这个例句中，它的意思是强调スマートフォン和为现代电子设备供电的内存芯片的需求在经济不确定性的情况下仍然低迷。

  • Sluggish (adj.) —— 缓慢的，迟钝的，不景气的。

    原文例句：In December, rival Micron Technology delivered a better-than-projected revenue outlook that suggested data centre construction may make up for the lukewarm computing and mobile devices markets.

    例句讲解：这个单词由slug（鼻涕虫）和-ish（形容词后缀）组成，表示“缓慢的，迟钝的，不景气的”。在这个例句中，它的意思是计算和移动设备市场的低迷。

词组：

  • in the field of —— 在……领域。

    原文例句：Samsung now aims to catch up with rival SK Hynix in the burgeoning field of high-density memory chips, where it plans to increase capacity by 2.5 times in 2024.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由in（在……里面），the（限定词）和field（领域）组成的，表示“在……领域”。在这个例句中，它的意思是三星现在计划在 2024 年在高密度存储芯片领域追赶竞争对手 SK Hynix，计划将产能提高 2.5 倍。

句子：

  • Revenue came to 67 trillion won, compared with projections for 70.31 trillion won. —— 收入达到 67 万亿韩元，而预计为 70.31 万亿韩元。

    句子分析：这个句子是一个简单的句子，主语是Revenue，谓语是came，宾语是to 67 trillion won。compared with projections for 70.31 trillion won是一个介词短语，作状语，修饰谓语came，表示收入达到 67 万亿韩元，而预计为 70.31 万亿韩元。这个句子的意思是收入达到 67 万亿韩元，而预计为 70.31 万亿韩元。

语法：

  • 被动语态 - 表示动作或状态是被动的，强调动作或状态的承受者。

    原文例句：Prices should start climbing out of troughs around the latter part of 2023, executives said at the time.

    语法讲解：这是一个常见的句型，结构是：be + 过去分词。其中be要根据主语的人称和数进行变化，过去分词是动词的-ed形式或不规则变化形式。这种语态表示动作或状态是被动的，强调动作或状态的承受者。在这个例句中，它表示价格应该在 2023 年下半年开始从低谷中爬升。

  • South Korea’s largest company reported a 35 per cent fall in operating income to 2.8 trillion won (US$2.1 billion), versus the 3.7 trillion won average of analysts’ estimates
  • Samsung now aims to catch up with rival SK Hynix in the burgeoning field of high-density memory chips, where it plans to increase capacity by 2.5 times in 2024

Samsung Electronics posted its sixth straight quarter of declining operating profit, reflecting stubbornly weak demand for consumer electronics globally.

South Korea’s largest company reported a 35 per cent fall in operating income to 2.8 trillion won (US$2.1 billion), versus the 3.7 trillion won average of analysts’ estimates. Revenue came to 67 trillion won, compared with projections for 70.31 trillion won.

The results underscore how demand for smartphones and the memory chips that power modern electronics remains sluggish given economic uncertainty.

In December, rival Micron Technology delivered a better-than-projected revenue outlook that suggested data centre construction may make up for the lukewarm computing and mobile devices markets.

Tech giants Alibaba, ByteDance lead China’s return to CES

“I think this shows that the rebound is slower than we all thought,” said Tom Kang, research director at Counterpoint Technology. “Prices are not rising that fast and the demand from certain sectors is not that strong.”

Samsung in October predicted the long-depressed US$160 billion memory market will bounce back gradually in 2024, driven by a boom in artificial intelligence (AI) development. Prices should start climbing out of troughs around the latter part of 2023, executives said at the time.

The company will release a full earnings report, with divisional breakdowns, on January 31.

Samsung now aims to catch up with rival SK Hynix in the burgeoning field of high-density memory chips, where it plans to increase capacity by 2.5 times in 2024. HBM, an advanced chip that handles data more quickly, works with hardware such as Nvidia’s accelerators to speed up data processing for intensive tasks like training AI models.

Samsung is also counting on a new line-up of devices and foldable smartphones to drive growth in 2024. The Korean tech conglomerate is preparing to unveil its latest gadgets in the US later this month, at a time investors worry Apple’s iPhone 15 may be running out of steam mere months after launch.

item.title: Alibaba’s AliExpress, PDD-owned Temu face supply chain challenges in South Korea amid rapid business expansion
item.description:
English Summary：

  • AliExpress and Temu, two popular Chinese online shopping platforms in South Korea, struggle with long delivery times and product quality issues, despite their fast growth.
  • Korean consumers are hesitant to replace local platforms due to these challenges and the prevalence of copycat products on AliExpress and Temu.
  • To address these concerns, AliExpress and Temu have implemented initiatives to enhance supply chain efficiency and product authenticity.

中文总结：

  • 阿里速卖通和拼多多，两个在中国流行的在线购物平台，尽管在韩国发展迅速，但依然面临着交货时间长和产品质量不足的问题。
  • 韩国消费者由于这些挑战以及阿里速卖通和拼多多上的仿冒产品盛行，因而犹豫是否要替换本地的平台。
  • 为了解决这些问题，阿里速卖通和拼多多已经开始实施提高供应链效率和产品真实性的举措。

单词：

  • grappling - (v.) 努力对付或处理。

    原文例句：China’s e-commerce giants are now the fastest-growing online platforms for Korean shoppers, but they are still grappling with problems of long delivery time and unstable product quality, according to consumers and retail industry officials.

    例句讲解：这个单词源自古诺斯语，意思是“抓握、搏斗”。在这个例句中，它表示中国电子商务巨头现在是韩国购物者增长最快的在线平台，但他们仍在努力解决消费者和零售业官员报告的交货时间长和产品质量不稳定的问题。

  • cautious - (adj.) 小心的，谨慎的。

    原文例句：But on the flip side, some consumers in Korea remain cautious about replacing local online retail sites, such as Coupang and Gmarket, owing to the Chinese platforms’ supply chain problems that include long delivery time and unstable product quality.

    例句讲解：这个单词源自拉丁语，意思是“小心、谨慎”。在这个例句中，它表示但另一方面，由于中国平台的供应链问题包括交货时间长和产品质量不稳定，韩国一些消费者仍然谨慎地对待替换本地在线零售网站，例如Coupang和Gmarket。

  • authenticity - (n.) 真实性，可靠性。

    原文例句：He suggested that these platforms set up a “patrol system” to punish counterfeiters.

    例句讲解：这个单词源自希腊语，意思是“真实的、可靠的”。在这个例句中，它表示他建议这些平台建立一个“巡逻系统”来惩罚造假者。

词组：

  • long delivery time - 交货时间长。

    原文例句：AliExpress Group Holding and PDD, two of the largest e-commerce companies in China, have been aggressively expanding their foothold in South Korea, offering prices as low as US$1 for some small gadgets on their overseas shopping platforms AliExpress and Temu, respectively.

    例句讲解：这个词组由long（长的）和delivery time（交货时间）组成，表示交货时间长。

  • unstable product quality - 产品质量不稳定。

    原文例句：Alibaba Group Holding and PDD, two of the largest e-commerce companies in China, have been aggressively expanding their foothold in South Korea, offering prices as low as US$1 for some small gadgets on their overseas shopping platforms AliExpress and Temu, respectively.

    例句讲解：这个词组由unstable（不稳定的）和product quality（产品质量）组成，表示产品质量不稳定。

  • copycat products - 仿冒产品。

    原文例句：Korea was ranked as the world’s fourth-largest e-commerce market with a projected revenue of US$139.8 billion in 2023, according to a report from online database ECDB.

    例句讲解：这个词组由copycat（模仿）和products（产品）组成，表示仿冒产品。

句子：

  • To address these concerns, AliExpress and Temu have implemented initiatives to enhance supply chain efficiency and product authenticity. - 为了解决这些问题，阿里速卖通和拼多多已经开始实施提高供应链效率和产品真实性的举措。
